articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around
articleDescription: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…
articleContent:
Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its huge workforce about 15,000 jobs as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD.
In a memo to staff,… [+4460 chars]
fqTitle: Will Intel reduce its workforce by at least 14% by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Intel confirms a reduction of at least 14% of its total workforce by August 31, 2024. The reduction must be officially announced or reported by Intel or in reputable financial news sources. If the reduction is less than 14% or not confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around

In a memo to staff,… [+4460 chars]
fqTitle: Will Intel lay off more than 14,000 employees by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Intel officially announces or confirms layoffs exceeding 14,000 employees by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from Intel or be reported by at least two major financial news outlets. If the number of layoffs is 14,000 or fewer, or if the information is not confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around

fqTitle: Will Intel's stock price increase by more than 10% within 3 months of announcing major layoffs by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Intel's stock price increases by more than 10% within 3 months of announcing layoffs of at least 10,000 employees, with the announcement occurring by August 31, 2024. The stock price change will be measured from the closing price on the day of the announcement to the closing price exactly 3 months later. If no such announcement is made, or if the stock price does not increase by more than 10% within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

fqTitle: Will a major chip manufacturer announce layoffs of over 10,000 employees by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if any major chip manufacturer (including but not limited to Intel, AMD, or Nvidia) officially announces layoffs exceeding 10,000 employees by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by the company or reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. If no such announcement is made or confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday to be celebrated with musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre

articleContent:
ATLANTA (AP) Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month, ahead of his 100th birthday, with a musical gala at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta, The Carter Center announced Thursday. 
The Sept… [+1834 chars]
fqTitle: Will a musical gala honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday occur at Atlanta's Fox Theatre by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a musical gala celebrating Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday takes place at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta by August 31, 2024. The event must be officially recognized as honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday and must occur at the specified venue. If the event is canceled, postponed beyond the resolution date, or moved to a different venue, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday to be celebrated with musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre

fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Jimmy Carter personally attends a celebration event for his 100th birthday at a major venue in Atlanta by August 31, 2024. The event must be officially recognized as a celebration of Carter's 100th birthday. If Carter does not attend in person due to health reasons, cancellation, or any other cause, the question resolves as NO.

fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a celebration event for the 100th birthday of a former U.S. President includes musical performances and takes place at a historic theater in Atlanta by August 31, 2024. The event must be officially recognized as a centennial celebration and include multiple musical acts. If the event does not feature musical performances or is not held at a historic Atlanta theater, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner
articleDescription: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday told visiting Vietnamese…
articleContent:
NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.
Prime Min… [+1925 chars]
fqTitle: Will India provide a $300 million loan to Vietnam for maritime security by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if India provides a $300 million loan to Vietnam specifically for maritime security purposes by August 31, 2024. The loan must be officially confirmed by both Indian and Vietnamese government sources or reported by at least two major international news outlets. If the loan is not provided, or if it is provided but for a different purpose or amount, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner

Prime Min… [+1925 chars]
fqTitle: Will India and Vietnam double their trade and investment by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if official economic data or reports from reputable international organizations confirm that trade and investment between India and Vietnam have doubled compared to their levels in October 2023, by August 31, 2024. If the trade and investment levels have not doubled by this date, or if there is insufficient data to confirm such an increase, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner

fqTitle: Will Vietnam announce a major maritime security project funded by a foreign loan by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Vietnam officially announces a significant maritime security project that is funded, at least in part, by a foreign loan by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Vietnamese government source or be reported by at least two major international news outlets. The project must be specifically related to maritime security. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger

fqTitle: Will Paul J. DeCologero receive additional prison time for a new offense by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Paul J. DeCologero, who was sentenced for his involvement in James 'Whitey' Bulger's death, receives additional prison time for a new offense committed after his sentencing. The new offense must be separate from the Bulger case. The additional sentence must be officially announced by a court or correctional authority.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger

fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a major film studio or production company officially announces plans to produce a feature-length film primarily focused on the circumstances of James 'Whitey' Bulger's death in prison. The announcement must come from the studio or production company itself or be reported by at least two major entertainment news outlets.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger

fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the U.S. Department of Justice or a relevant federal agency announces a new, comprehensive investigation into safety measures and protocols in federal prisons. The investigation must be explicitly linked to high-profile incidents in federal prisons. The announcement must come from an official government source or be reported by at least two major news outlets.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) The United States and Russia completed their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history on Thursday, with Moscow releasing journalist Evan Gershkovich and fellow American Paul Whela… [+5197 chars]
fqTitle: Will Russia and the United States conduct another prisoner swap involving at least 3 individuals by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if Russia and the United States conduct a prisoner swap involving at least 3 individuals (in total, from both sides combined) by August 31, 2024. The swap must be officially confirmed by government representatives or reputable news sources from both countries. A prisoner swap refers to an exchange of detained individuals between the two nations. The resolution is based on the occurrence of the swap, not its announcement or planning stages.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) The United States and Russia completed their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history on Thursday, with Moscow releasing journalist Evan Gershkovich and fellow American Paul Whela… [+5197 chars]
fqTitle: Will Evan Gershkovich publish a book about his experiences in Russian detention by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Evan Gershkovich, a journalist previously detained in Russia, publishes a book (in any language) detailing his experiences during his detention in Russia by August 31, 2024. Publication refers to the book being made available for purchase through major book retailers or reputable publishing houses. The book must be authored or co-authored by Gershkovich and focus primarily on his detention experience. Announcements or pre-orders of the book do not count as publication for this question's resolution.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...

fqTitle: Will a US journalist be detained in Russia on espionage charges by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a journalist holding United States citizenship is detained in Russia on charges related to espionage or similar allegations by August 31, 2024. The detention must be officially acknowledged by Russian authorities and reported by multiple reputable international news sources. The charges must be explicitly stated as espionage or closely related accusations. The resolution is based on the occurrence of the detention, not on the validity of the charges or the outcome of any legal proceedings.

articleTitle: Utah's near-total abortion ban to remain blocked until lower court assesses its constitutionality
articleDescription: A near-total abortion ban will remain on hold in Utah after the state Supreme Court ruled that the law should remain blocked until a lower court can assess its constitutionality. With the decision, abortion remains legal up to 18 weeks. The panel wrote in its…
articleContent: SALT LAKE CITY (AP) A near-total abortion ban will remain on hold in Utah after the state Supreme Court ruled Thursday that the law should remain blocked until a lower court can assess its constituti… [+3668 chars]
fqTitle: Will Utah's near-total abortion ban remain blocked by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Utah's near-total abortion ban remains blocked by August 31, 2024. The ban is considered 'blocked' if it is not in effect due to legal challenges or court orders. If the ban is implemented or goes into effect before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. The status will be determined based on official statements from Utah's government or court rulings.

articleTitle: Utah's near-total abortion ban to remain blocked until lower court assesses its constitutionality
articleDescription: A near-total abortion ban will remain on hold in Utah after the state Supreme Court ruled that the law should remain blocked until a lower court can assess its constitutionality. With the decision, abortion remains legal up to 18 weeks. The panel wrote in its…

fqTitle: Will abortion remain legal up to 18 weeks in Utah by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if abortion remains legal in Utah for pregnancies up to 18 weeks by August 31, 2024. If the legal limit for abortions in Utah is reduced below 18 weeks or increased beyond 18 weeks before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. The status will be determined based on official Utah state laws or court rulings in effect on the resolution date.

articleTitle: Utah's near-total abortion ban to remain blocked until lower court assesses its constitutionality

fqTitle: Will a state Supreme Court ruling on an abortion law be overturned by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a state Supreme Court ruling related to an abortion law is overturned by a higher court or through legislative action by August 31, 2024. The overturning must be explicitly stated and officially recognized. If no such overturning occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. The status will be determined based on official court documents or legislative records.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
articleDescription: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …
articleContent:
The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.
Jobl… [+2061 chars]
fqTitle: Will weekly U.S. jobless claims exceed 275,000 by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the U.S. Department of Labor reports that initial jobless claims for any single week exceed 275,000 by August 31, 2024. The figure must be reported in the official weekly release and not be subsequently revised below 275,000. If no such week occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
articleDescription: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …

The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.

fqTitle: Will U.S. unemployment rate rise above 4.5% by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports a monthly unemployment rate above 4.5% for any month up to and including August 2024. The rate must be reported in the official monthly jobs report and not be subsequently revised below 4.5%. If no such month occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year

The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.

fqTitle: Will a major U.S. company announce layoffs affecting over 10,000 employees by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a publicly traded U.S. company listed on the S&P 500 index announces layoffs affecting more than 10,000 employees in a single announcement by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. If no such announcement occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…
articleContent:
The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.
Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will a U.S. Department of Transportation rule banning airlines from charging parents to sit with young children be implemented by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the U.S. Department of Transportation implements a rule that prohibits airlines from charging additional fees for parents to sit with their children aged 13 or younger. The rule must be officially implemented and in effect by August 31, 2024. If the rule is not implemented or is still pending by this date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…

The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.

fqTitle: Will major U.S. airlines voluntarily adopt policies to seat children with parents at no extra charge by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if at least three of the top five U.S. airlines by passenger volume voluntarily implement policies to seat children aged 13 or younger with their parents without charging additional fees. These policies must be publicly announced and put into practice by August 31, 2024. If fewer than three major airlines adopt such policies by this date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children

Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will a consumer advocacy group file a lawsuit challenging airline family seating policies by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a recognized consumer advocacy organization files a lawsuit in a U.S. court challenging the legality or fairness of airline policies regarding family seating arrangements. The lawsuit must be specifically related to charges for seating children with their parents and must be filed by August 31, 2024. If no such lawsuit is filed by this date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Police fire gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests over Nigeria's economy. At least 2 killed
articleDescription: Security forces have fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the country’s spiraling economy. At least two people were reported killed in northern Niger stat…
articleContent: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) Security forces fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria on Thursday as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the count… [+3186 chars]
fqTitle: Will Nigeria declare a state of emergency due to protests by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the Nigerian government officially declares a state of emergency in response to widespread protests across the country by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be made by the President or an authorized government official and reported by at least two major international news outlets. A state of emergency typically involves extraordinary measures such as curfews, increased security presence, or suspension of certain civil liberties. The declaration must be directly linked to protests similar to those described in recent events.

articleTitle: Police fire gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests over Nigeria's economy. At least 2 killed
articleDescription: Security forces have fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the country’s spiraling economy. At least two people were reported killed in northern Niger stat…
articleContent: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) Security forces fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria on Thursday as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the count… [+3186 chars]
fqTitle: Will a Nigerian protest leader be arrested by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a prominent organizer or leader of protests in Nigeria is arrested and charged with a crime related to their involvement in organizing or participating in protests by August 31, 2024. The arrest must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources. A 'prominent' leader is defined as someone who has been publicly identified as a key figure in organizing or leading protests, and whose arrest is deemed newsworthy by major media outlets.

articleTitle: Police fire gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests over Nigeria's economy. At least 2 killed
articleDescription: Security forces have fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the country’s spiraling economy. At least two people were reported killed in northern Niger stat…
articleContent: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) Security forces fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria on Thursday as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the count… [+3186 chars]
fqTitle: Will Nigeria's government implement major economic reforms by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the Nigerian government announces and begins implementing a set of major economic reforms in response to widespread protests by August 31, 2024. 'Major economic reforms' are defined as significant policy changes that directly address the economic concerns raised in the protests, such as changes to subsidies, currency policies, or anti-corruption measures. The reforms must be officially announced by the government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

articleTitle: US road safety agency will look into fatal crash near Seattle involving Tesla using automated system
articleDescription: U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the company’s “Full Self-Driving” system when it hit and killed a motorcyclist. The National Highway Traffic Safety A…
articleContent: DETROIT (AP) U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the companys Full Self-Driving system when i… [+1955 chars]
fqTitle: Will NHTSA conclude its investigation into a Tesla 'Full Self-Driving' fatal crash by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) officially concludes and releases findings from its investigation into a fatal crash involving a Tesla vehicle operating on 'Full Self-Driving' mode near Seattle by August 31, 2024. The investigation must specifically address the crash mentioned in the question title. If NHTSA has not concluded the investigation or released findings by this date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: US road safety agency will look into fatal crash near Seattle involving Tesla using automated system
articleDescription: U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the company’s “Full Self-Driving” system when it hit and killed a motorcyclist. The National Highway Traffic Safety A…
articleContent: DETROIT (AP) U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the companys Full Self-Driving system when i… [+1955 chars]
fqTitle: Will Tesla suspend its 'Full Self-Driving' feature in response to a fatal crash investigation by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Tesla officially announces a suspension or temporary halt of its 'Full Self-Driving' feature in direct response to an ongoing investigation into a fatal crash involving the system by August 31, 2024. The suspension must be company-wide and clearly linked to the investigation mentioned in the question title. If no such suspension is announced by this date, or if Tesla only implements minor modifications without suspending the feature, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: US road safety agency will look into fatal crash near Seattle involving Tesla using automated system
articleDescription: U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the company’s “Full Self-Driving” system when it hit and killed a motorcyclist. The National Highway Traffic Safety A…
articleContent: DETROIT (AP) U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the companys Full Self-Driving system when i… [+1955 chars]
fqTitle: Will U.S. road safety regulators propose new automated driving system rules by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if U.S. road safety regulators, such as the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA), officially propose new rules or regulations specifically addressing automated driving systems in passenger vehicles by August 31, 2024. The proposed rules must be in response to safety concerns raised by incidents involving such systems. If no such proposals are made public by this date, the question resolves as NO.
